org.jtrim.swing.access

Class ButtonCancelSwitcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.swing.access.ButtonCancelSwitcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AccessChangeAction

    public final class ButtonCancelSwitcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements AccessChangeAction
    Defines an AccessChangeAction which sets the caption of a JButton depending on the availability of the associated group of rights.

    The intended use of the ButtonCancelSwitcher is to set the cancel caption for the button when the given rights are not available (assuming that they are not available because of a task which maybe canceled).

    Note that ButtonCancelSwitcher does call the setText method of the JButton instances in the onChangeAccess method, so the AccessManager governing the rights must be set to use an executor which submits tasks to the AWT event dispatch thread (or wrap the ComponentDisabler in an AccessChangeAction which makes sure that the onChangeAccess method does not get called on an inappropriate thread).

    Thread safety

    The onChangeAccess may only be called from the AWT event dispatch thread but other methods are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ButtonCancelSwitcher(javax.swing.JButton button, java.lang.String cancelCaption)
      Creates a new ButtonCancelSwitcher using the specified button and caption for the state when the rights are not available.
      ButtonCancelSwitcher(javax.swing.JButton button, java.lang.String caption, java.lang.String cancelCaption)
      Creates a new ButtonCancelSwitcher using the specified button and captions for the state when the rights are available and when they are not.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ButtonCancelSwitcher

        public ButtonCancelSwitcher(javax.swing.JButton button,
                    java.lang.String cancelCaption)
        Creates a new ButtonCancelSwitcher using the specified button and caption for the state when the rights are not available. When the rights are available, the current caption of the button is used.

        Note: This constructor calls the getText() method of the button and therefore can only be called from the AWT event dispatch thread.

        Parameters:
        button - the button whose caption is to be set depending on the availability of the associated rights. This argument cannot be null and cannot have a null text property.
        cancelCaption - the caption to be used for the button when the associated rights are not available. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null or the text property of the specified button is null

      • ButtonCancelSwitcher

        public ButtonCancelSwitcher(javax.swing.JButton button,
                    java.lang.String caption,
                    java.lang.String cancelCaption)
        Creates a new ButtonCancelSwitcher using the specified button and captions for the state when the rights are available and when they are not.
        Parameters:
        button - the button whose caption is to be set depending on the availability of the associated rights. This argument cannot be null.
        caption - the caption to be used for the button when the associated rights are available. This argument cannot be null.
        cancelCaption - the caption to be used for the button when the associated rights are not available. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • Method Detail

      • onChangeAccess

        public void onChangeAccess(boolean available)
        Sets the text property of button according to the available argument. That is, sets it to the caption argument of the constructor (or the button caption for the two arguments constructor) if available is true; and sets it to the cancelCaption argument of the constructor if available is false.
        Specified by:
        onChangeAccess in interface AccessChangeAction
        Parameters:
        available - the boolean value defining which caption to use as explained in the method documentation
